artist: Artist: Tsukioka Yoshitoshi; Publisher: Masadaya Heikichi; Carver: Shimada Tomekichi
catalogue_raissonne: Keyes, Courage and Silence (1982), no. 280.4; Iwakiri, Yoshitoshi (2014), fig. 82, p. 284.
creditline: The Mary Griggs Burke Endowment Fund established by the Mary Livingston Griggs and Mary Griggs Burke Foundation, gifts of various donors, by exchange, and gift of Edmond Freis in memory of his parents, Rose and Leon Freis
description: one sheet; man seen from back wearing kimonos with floral designs with red and purple backgrounds, carrying a grey pagoda with red characters; man has long hair, thick eyebrows, thick sideburns and beard, with his face in profile from PR; various gruesome demons behind man including large white face with wide mouth at top center, with a face on its chest, screaming hairy torso with snakes and blue and green demon faces
markings: Artist’s seal: 月岡 {Tsukioka} | Carver’s seal: 彫工留 {horikō Tome}| Censor seal: 壬申十一
medium: Woodblock print (nishiki-e); ink and color on paper
portfolio: From Essays by Yoshitoshi (Ikkai zuihitsu 一魁随筆)
signed: 一魁斎芳年筆 {Ikkaisai Yoshitoshi hitsu}
title: Chao Gai, the Pagoda-shifting Heavenly King
